intro: Crotalaria singulifloroides, commonly known as the single-flowered cowpea, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features palmate leaves with three to five leaflets and produces showy, yellow flowers with a prominent central spur. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
